appdescription.message: Encode and decode base64, hex, html, generate hashes (MD5/SHA), check xml, Base64 images and other string operations. Works offline.

b64e_h.message:
Encode a Base64 string using standard Base64 encoding (RFC 3548 or RFC 4648).
Base64 is a group of similar binary-to-text encoding schemes that represent binary data in an ASCII string format by translating it into a radix-64 representation. Base64 encoding schemes are commonly used when there is a need to encode binary data that needs to be stored and transferred over media that are designed to deal with textual data. This is to ensure that the data remain intact without modification during transport.

b64d_h.message:
Decode a Base64 string (RFC 3548 or RFC 4648).
Base64 is a group of similar binary-to-text encoding schemes that represent binary data in an ASCII string format by translating it into a radix-64 representation.

b64eu_h.message:
Base64 encode with URL and Filename Safe Alphabet.
Replaces:
'=' with '_'
'/' with ','
'+' with '-'

b64du_h.message:
Base64 decode with URL and filename safe alphabet.
Replaces:
'_' with '='
',' with '/'
'-' with '+'

b64diu_h.message:
Displays a Base64 encoded image.
Example: data:image/png;base64,/9j/4AAQSgA==

urle_h.message: Encode chars that would normally be recognized as special chars for URLs. This method does not encode the ' char. Uses javascript encodeURIComponent() function.

urld_h.message: Decode special chars in URLs. Uses javascript decodeURIComponent() function.

htmle_h.message: Encode chars that would normally be recognized as special chars in HTML. Replace &,",',<,>

htmld_h.message: Decode chars that would normally be recognized as special chars in HTML. Replace &amp;,&quot;,&#39;,&lt;,&gt;

md5h_h.message: The MD5 Message-Digest Algorithm is a widely used cryptographic hash function that produces a 128-bit (16-byte) hash value. An MD5 hash is typically expressed as a hexadecimal number, 32 digits long.

md564_h.message: The MD5 Message-Digest Algorithm is a widely used cryptographic hash function that produces a 128-bit (16-byte) hash value. This function returns the value as Base64.

sha1_h.message: A 160-bit hash function which resembles the earlier MD5 algorithm. This was designed by the National Security Agency (NSA) to be part of the Digital Signature Algorithm. Cryptographic weaknesses were discovered in SHA-1, and the standard was no longer approved for most cryptographic uses after 2010.

sha224_h.message: A family of two similar hash functions, with different block sizes, known as SHA-256 and SHA-512. They differ in the word size; SHA-256 uses 32-bit words where SHA-512 uses 64-bit words. There are also truncated versions of each standardized, known as SHA-224 and SHA-384. These were also designed by the NSA.

sha256_h.message: A family of two similar hash functions, with different block sizes, known as SHA-256 and SHA-512. They differ in the word size; SHA-256 uses 32-bit words where SHA-512 uses 64-bit words. There are also truncated versions of each standardized, known as SHA-224 and SHA-384. These were also designed by the NSA.

sha384_h.message: A family of two similar hash functions, with different block sizes, known as SHA-256 and SHA-512. They differ in the word size; SHA-256 uses 32-bit words where SHA-512 uses 64-bit words. There are also truncated versions of each standardized, known as SHA-224 and SHA-384. These were also designed by the NSA.

sha512_h.message: A family of two similar hash functions, with different block sizes, known as SHA-256 and SHA-512. They differ in the word size; SHA-256 uses 32-bit words where SHA-512 uses 64-bit words. There are also truncated versions of each standardized, known as SHA-224 and SHA-384. These were also designed by the NSA.

rot13_h.message: ROT13 shifts every alpha characters by 13 places in the alphabet. This function decodes and encodes ROT13.

emED_h.message: Obfuscate a string by converting it to base64 then rot13 it, urlencode it, reverse it and base64 encode it again.

dmED_h.message: Deobfuscate a string by Base64 decoding it then reversing it, urldecoding it, rot13 it and Base64 decoding it again.

c2d_h.message: Replaces all commas in string with a period.

invalid.message: Sorry, but it was not possible to convert the given string.

crc32_h.message: A cyclic redundancy check (CRC) is an error-detecting code commonly used in digital networks and storage devices to detect accidental changes to raw data. Uses 33 bits polynomial.

stgs_h.message: Strip HTML, comments and PHP tags from a string

addslashes_h.message: Returns a string with backslashes before characters that need to be quoted in database queries etc. These characters are single quote ('), double quote (") and backslash (\).

ucwords_h.message: Uppercase the first character of each word in a string

morerootnode.message: More than one root node or unexpected tag

checkxml_h.message: Check if string has a valid XML structure

str_repeat_h.message: Repeat a string n times. You should avoid large strings and/or larger repeat values as it can crash your browser.

escapejavas_h.message: Escape chars that would normally be recognized as special chars in javascript.

html2js_h.message: Escape chars that would normally be recognized as special chars in javascript and create a javascript function with the content.

checkUUID_h.message: Check if a universally unique identifier (UUID) v4 is valid.

generateUUID_h.message: A universally unique identifier (UUID) is an identifier standard used in software construction, standardized by the Open Software Foundation (OSF) as part of the Distributed Computing Environment (DCE). Using the default mask generates an UUID v4. You can generate random IDs by changing the mask using x(hex) and y (ab89) as the random chars.

trim_h.message: Strip whitespace (or other characters) from the beginning and end of a string.

chromebanner.message: or if you wish, you can download our offline app. Just

dohex_h.message: Convert hexadecimal code to ASCII code. Each hexadecimal digit represents four binary digits (bits), and the primary use of hexadecimal notation is a human-friendly representation of binary-coded values in computing and digital electronics. One hexadecimal digit represents a nibble, which is half of an octet or byte (8 bits). ASCII codes represent text in computers, communications equipment, and other devices that use text.

doascii_h.message: Convert ASCII to hexadecimal code. ASCII codes represent text in computers, communications equipment, and other devices that use text. Each hexadecimal digit represents four binary digits (bits), and the primary use of hexadecimal notation is a human-friendly representation of binary-coded values in computing and digital electronics. One hexadecimal digit represents a nibble, which is half of an octet or byte (8 bits).

stripsc_h.message: Strip any special characters that are not in ASCII range

latin2e_h.message: Convert latin special chars to english chars.

morsee_h.message: Encode english string to Morse Code. Morse code is a method of transmitting text information as a series of on-off tones, lights, or clicks. Each character (letter or numeral) is represented by a unique sequence of dots and dashes.

ascii2bin_h.message: Convert ASCII to binary code. ASCII codes represent text in computers, communications equipment, and other devices that use text. A Binary code is a way of representing text or computer processor instructions by the use of the binary number system's two-binary digits 0 and 1. This is accomplished by assigning a bit string to each particular symbol or instruction.

bin2ascii_h.message: Convert binary code to ASCII. A Binary code is a way of representing text or computer processor instructions by the use of the binary number system's two-binary digits 0 and 1. This is accomplished by assigning a bit string to each particular symbol or instruction. ASCII codes represent text in computers, communications equipment, and other devices that use text.

javascript_escape_h.message: Escape string using hex values. Can be used for code, in this case use the eval function.

encodeimgbase64_h.message: Encode image in Base64 png so it can be embedded in html and css. Currently is only possible the conversion to PNG format. This feature is still experimental, we would appreciate your feedback.
